question: Select main differences between GRU and LSTM

answers.answer: Number of gates. LSTM has 3 gates, while GRU has 2.
answers.feedback: In LSTM they are the Input gate, Forget gate, and Output gate. Whereas in GRU we have a Reset gate and Update gate.

answers.answer: Unlike GRU, LSTM has a separate gate responsible for internal memory.
answers.feedback: Indeed GRU doesn't possess an internal memory.

answers.answer: Due to fewer amount of elements in side single cell, GRU has a faster covergence rate.
answers.feedback: GRU has fewer parameters (U and W are smaller) and thus may train a bit faster or need less data to generalize.
